snippet: The Hamas movement is deviating from the approved Palestinian Authority curriculum, using the new texts as part of a broader push to infuse the next generation with its militant ideology.
abstract: Hamas movement has begun deviating from standard curriculum approved by the Palestinian Authority, issuing revised textbook as part of broader push to infuse next generation with its militant ideology; books, which are used by 55,000 8th, 9th and 10th grade children, do not recognize modern Israel, one of several points that may represent obstacle to peace talks newly resumed under American pressure.

byline.original: By FARES AKRAM and JODI RUDOREN
byline.contributor: Fares Akram reported from Gaza, and Jodi Rudoren from Jerusalem.

lead_paragraph: The Hamas movement is deviating from the approved Palestinian Authority curriculum, using the new texts as part of a broader push to infuse the next generation with its militant ideology.

headline.main: To Shape Young Palestinians, Hamas Creates Its Own Textbooks
headline.print_headline: To Shape Young Palestinians, Hamas Creates Its Own Textbooks
